definition: special appointment
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
to appoint
full-time/to appoint sb to a specific task
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
to teach/to instruct/to award/to give
to accept a position on a provisional basis, in the absence of better qualified candidates (humble expr.)
select the best people for promotion
special appointment/special correspondent/task force/sb dispatched on a mission
foreign affairs
to supervise and direct/army title (archaic)
secretary-general
to hire/to employ/to engage
government office
